input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENT OF GERS. Summary: Execution of Collective School Transport Services for Pupils and Students with Disabilities in the Department of Gers and its Neighboring Departments. Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is to entrust the holders with the provision of collective school transport services for students with disabilities between the defined place of care and their schools or general education establishments, agricultural or professional, public or private placed under contract; and students with disabilities between the defined place of care and their higher education establishments, under the Ministry of National Education or the Ministry of Agriculture. The service is generally daily, but can be weekly if the student is a boarder. Transportation, depending on needs, will be provided by private vehicle or vehicle adapted to be accessible to a wheelchair. It is about a framework agreement with purchase orders without minimum amount and with an annual maximum amount for each lot. Published Date: 2025-12-27. Closing Date: 2026-02-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Execution of Collective School Transport Services for Pupils and Students with Disabilities in the Department of Gers and its Neighboring Departments

The service is generally daily, but can be weekly if the student is a boarder. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENT OF ISÈRE. Summary: Rental, Installation, Storage, Demolition and Maintenance of Modular Buildings for the Department of Isère. Description: The framework agreement will be executed by the conclusion of subsequent contracts and the issuance of purchase orders under the conditions of the specifications. Each lot will be awarded separately. Services are regulated by unit prices. There consultation concerns the installation of modular buildings intended to be installed as needed within the limits of the department of Isère. These buildings are made up of one or more modules, forming teaching premises, technical, or offices. This consultation is allocated and includes a first lot for the installation and transfer of modules owned by the Department of Isère, and a second lot for the rental and acquisition of modules. Lot 1 concerns installation, transfers from one place of use to another, from one place of use to a place of storage (or vice versa), demolitions and repairs of COPREBAT or COFICIEL brand modular buildings for use as offices, meeting rooms class including courtyards (Texabri brand), and maritime containers belonging to the Department of Isère. The current list of modular buildings located in the department of Isère with the registration number, their type, brand and their location is annexed to the Specifications of specific technical clauses. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PROVENCE-ALPES-CÔTE D-AZUR REGION. Summary: Supply, Installation, Marking, Care and Maintenance of Furniture and Signaling of Coach Stops in the Zou Network! of the Provence-Alpes-Cote D-Azur Region. Summary: Transport Services for Equipment, Various Materials and Mail for the Val D'Oise Departmental Fire and Rescue Service (2025-100). Description: The description and technical specifications are defined in the Specifications of Particular Clauses (CCP) as well as in the breakdown of the overall and fixed price (DPGF) and the unit price schedule (BPU). In fact, it is for the service departmental fire and rescue department of Val d'Oise to enlist the services of a service provider for the transport of equipment, various materials and mail in its various structures located in Val d'Oise: the departmental management, the departmental technical center, the departmental training center, the 3 group command centers as well as the 39 rescue centers, the intermediate logistics platform 1 and 2 and the departmental logistics platform. Please note that the This market will have three phases of execution: - Current situation: technical workshops, PLi1 - PLi2 and decentralized pharmacy (PUI). - Transitional situation: phase of gradual move of the workshops and the PUI to the PLD (logistics platform departmental) in Saint-Ouen l'Aumône. - Final situation: centralization of workshops, from PL1-PLi2 and from the PUI to the PLD. In fact, the PLD departmental logistics platform, currently under construction but partially used, will be fully operational during January 2027 (forecast date). The holder of this framework agreement must therefore provide an organization for the execution of the service of the 3 phases. These three modes of operation.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENTAL FIRE AND RESCUE SERVICE OF VAL D'OISE. Summary: Transport Services for Equipment, Various Materials and Mail for the Val D'Oise Departmental Fire and Rescue Service (2025-100). Description: The description and technical specifications are defined in the Specifications of Particular Clauses (CCP) as well as in the breakdown of the overall and fixed price (DPGF) and the unit price schedule (BPU). In fact, it is for the service departmental fire and rescue department of Val d'Oise to enlist the services of a service provider for the transport of equipment, various materials and mail in its various structures located in Val d'Oise: the departmental management, the departmental technical center, the departmental training center, the 3 group command centers as well as the 39 rescue centers, the intermediate logistics platform 1 and 2 and the departmental logistics platform. Please note that the This market will have three phases of execution: - Current situation: technical workshops, PLi1 - PLi2 and decentralized pharmacy (PUI). - Transitional situation: phase of gradual move of the workshops and the PUI to the PLD (logistics platform departmental) in Saint-Ouen l'Aumône. - Final situation: centralization of workshops, from PL1-PLi2 and from the PUI to the PLD. In fact, the PLD departmental logistics platform, currently under construction but partially used, will be fully operational during January 2027 (forecast date). The holder of this framework agreement must therefore provide an organization for the execution of the service of the 3 phases. These three modes of operation.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CORRÈZE DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL. Summary: School Transport for Students with Disabilities (2025Aff051). Description: The main characteristics are as follows: - ensuring, in accordance with the legislative and regulatory provisions in force, the transport of students with disabilities and specialized classes schooled in the Department of Corrèze (transport to and from students from their homes to educational establishments), - implement the services concerned during the school periods considered, once the routes, timetables and timetable assignments have been approved according to the terms which will be set out in the technical annex to the purchase orders. The Department takes charge of setting up specific transport for pupils and students with disabilities residing in Corrèze attending an establishment of general, agricultural or professional education, public or private when they cannot use public transport due to the severity of their disability, medically recognized and transmitted by the Departmental House of Persons disabled.. Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-07. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: School Transport for Students with Disabilities (2025Aff051)

The Department takes charge of setting up specific transport for pupils and students with disabilities residing in Corrèze attending an establishment of general, agricultural or professional education, public or private when they cannot use public transport due to the severity of their disability, medically recognized and transmitted by the Departmental House of Persons disabled.

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: INTERCOMMUNAL COMMUNITY NORTH REUNION. Summary: Supply and Maintenance of Cinor Garbage Bins. Description: The contract consists of: FIRM SECTION: - The supply of garbage bins intended for the collection of residual household waste, recyclable waste, and bio-waste (lots 1 and 2). - Maintenance of the trash bin fleet, belonging to CINOR (lots 1 and 2). - The temporary provision of garbage bins (lots 1 and 2). - The recovery and recycling of used bins (lots 1 and 2). - Computerized management of the container fleet (lots 1 and 2). - Call management and recording, and the organization of deliveries (lots 1 and 2). OPTIONAL TRANCHES (TO): - TO NO1 (lots 1 and 2): Chipping campaigns. - TO NO2 (lots 1 and 2): Staffing analyzes and surveys with a view to preventive maintenance or updating/adjustments of staffing on all or part of the park. - TO NO3 (lot 2): Supply, installation and maintenance of bio-waste bin shelters. The estimated value and the maximum value of the framework agreement mentioned in section 2.1.3 of this notice are those of the cumulative amount of lots 1 and 2 over the total duration of the contract (4 years).. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SEMOP TRANSPORT OF THE EUROMETROPOLIS OF METZ. Summary: Sourcing as Part of the Project to Acquire Electric Buses with their Pantograph or Flash Fast Charging System to Replace the Current 24M Hybrids. Description: As part of its energy transition strategy and the evolution of its BHNS lines, Transport de l'Eurométropole de Metz (which takes over, on January 1, 2026, from Transport de l'Agglomération de Metz Métropole (TAMM)), is launching a phase of sourcing aimed at identifying manufacturers capable of supplying 100% electric buses of 18 m and 24 m, as well as charging solutions adapted to operation in High Level of Service Bus (BHNS) mode. The objectives of sourcing are following: - Evaluate the maturity of the 18 m and 24 m electric bus solutions available or in the process of being approved. - Know the technical, industrial and logistical conditions of production. - Anticipate risks and optimization levers to successful integration on METTIS lines. The vehicles concerned by the sourcing are 100% electric articulated buses of 18 m and 24 m: - Compliance with European standards and urban integration constraints (templates, ramps, radius of gyration). - Passenger capacity adapted to the needs of METTIS lines (Nb Passenger / rate). - Performance in real operating conditions (autonomy, consumption, reliability). Information on charging solutions: - Charging systems depot, at terminus and online (pantograph, OppCharge, CCS2, etc.). - Integration of energy infrastructures (power, cycles, depot interfaces). - Partnerships with integrators for a solution.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: SEMOP TRANSPORT OF THE EUROMETROPOLIS OF METZ
output.Summary: Sourcing as Part of the Project to Acquire Electric Buses with their Pantograph or Flash Fast Charging System to Replace the Current 24M Hybrids

The objectives of sourcing are following: - Evaluate the maturity of the 18 m and 24 m electric bus solutions available or in the process of being approved. - Know the technical, industrial and logistical conditions of production. - Anticipate risks and optimization levers to successful integration on METTIS lines. The vehicles concerned by the sourcing are 100% electric articulated buses of 18 m and 24 m: - Compliance with European standards and urban integration constraints (templates, ramps, radius of gyration). - Passenger capacity adapted to the needs of METTIS lines (Nb Passenger / rate). - Performance in real operating conditions (autonomy, consumption, reliability). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF SAINT-MAUR-DES-FOSSÉS. Summary: Supply of Spare Parts, Various Accessories and Specific Tools for Vehicles. Description: The City has a municipal garage where qualified agents provide routine maintenance and repairs to the entire municipal vehicle fleet. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SNCF VOYAGEURS SA. Summary: Ti Spdc Boilermaking Cabins. Description: To date, the Technicentre de Saint Pierre des Corps (SPDC) carries out boilermaking and welding operations on Z20500 (Z2N) and TER2NNg bodies. By 2027, in addition to the current series of new NAT (New Transilien Automotive) trainsets will be processed on the SPDC site. In order to accommodate this new load, the technicentre needs to acquire an installation consisting of a set of two boilermaking welding cabins for the processing of steel and aluminum boxes. This together will be installed in a future building which will house the NAT checkouts. TI SPDC boilermaking cabins Doc Title: TI SPDC boilermaking cabins Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF SAINT-GERMAIN-EN-LAYE. Summary: Various Services for the Organization of the Fête Des Loges. Description: This framework agreement covers various services for the organization of the Fête des Loges. The Fête des Loges is a fairground event which takes place annually during the summer period. It is held at the location: Esplanade des Loges . Lot 2: Water network installation and management services The framework agreement consists of installing the water supply to the various bungalows and caravans of the Fête des Loges during the event. Lot 3: Office of control of facilities The framework agreement consists of verifying various installations located on the Esplanade des Loges by an approved inspection office. The festival includes 132 locations including 7 restaurants, 8 refreshment bars and 8 candy stores. These figures may vary from year to year. They will be provided to the service provider each year before the start of his mission. Lot 4: Removal, maintenance and reinstallation of safety barriers and/or concrete separators The annual service consists of the removal, maintenance and refitting of crash barriers and/or concrete separators. Doc Title: Various services for the organization of the Fête des Loges Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Various Services for the Organization of the Fête Des Loges

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ILE DE FRANCE MOBILITIES. Summary: Operation of the Ile-De-France Mobilités Transport on Demand (Tàd) Reservation Center. Description: In accordance with deliberation n°2017/123 of the Board of Directors of Île-de-France Mobi-lités of March 22, 2017, the purpose of this contract is the establishment, operation of a Service Center and the integration of TAD networks for transport at request in Île-de-France as described in the 6 missions below. - Mission 1: resumption of existing TàD services, implementation of a TàD reservation solution and integration into the MaaS Île-de-France Mobilités (PRIM) platform; - Assignment 2: integration of new labeled TàD services or significant modifications to existing services; - Mission 3: operation of the Service Center on the perimeter of labeled TàD and integrated into the service center; - Mission 4: implementation installation and management of a call center and an interactive voice server; - Mission 5: TàD programming advice and studies - Mission 6: support for performance management and quality of service. The objectives as well as the conditions of execution of the expected services, are specified in the specific technical clauses (CCTP).. Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-02-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SNCF NETWORK. Summary: Development / Supply and Mco Market for 6Th Generation Hot Box Detectors (Dbc 6). Description: The DBC System is a system that helps reduce the risk of derailment caused by damage to the rolling stock (axle box) or the risk of triggering embankment fires caused by an applied brake. To accomplish this mission, the DBC system monitors the temperature of the axle boxes and detects applied brakes when passing traffic. The DBC 6 Development, Supply and Maintenance in Operational Condition contract constitutes a building block of the overall monitoring project. Trains en Marche (STEM) from SNCF Réseau. It concerns a new generation of DBC, DBC 6, intended to replace or complement the generations of DBC currently deployed by SNCF Réseau on the National Rail Network. The DBC 6 market is made up of two Specifications and two Contracts, for a total duration of 27 years maximum, broken down as follows: •a Development and Supply Services Contract for systems and subsystems, for a maximum duration of 17 years (12 firm years and 5 years optional), including in particular the following services: -piloting, management and coordination of the project, -System and subsystem development, -implementation of an on-site SNCF Réseau certification platform, -establishment of a reduced platform simulation, -implementation of a workshop repair platform, -implementation of a maintenance training platform, -training in the installation of equipment, -workshop repair training.... Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2026-01-28. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

As such, this opinion concerns the competition for the management of following services: the Calibus service (4 urban lines, 6 non-urban lines, the two urban shuttles in Libourne and Coutras, the beach shuttle operating during the summer period, an on-demand transport service in municipalities not benefiting a regular line, a transport service for people with reduced mobility (TPMR), the Calivélo service offering self-service (282 bicycles) or long-term rental (220 electrically assisted bicycles (VAE); 30 electrically assisted folding bicycles ; 16 electrically assisted cargo bikes) and a car-sharing service. At this stage, it is envisaged to entrust the following services: the overall operation of the above-mentioned services, the upkeep, maintenance and replacement of goods necessary for the service (including counting cells and video surveillance), the recruitment and management of the personnel necessary for the operation of the network, the commercial and administrative management of the network, the reception of the public and animation of the house of mobility, network security control, display operations on street furniture, setting up a website and an application dedicated to the service. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: METROPOLIS OF LYON. Summary: Transport and Handling of Works of Art and Heritage Collections for the Lugdunum Museum. Description: Lugdunum Museum and Roman Theaters, equipment directly managed by the Metropolis of Lyon, located 17 rue Cléberg - 69005 Lyon, is an archaeological museum whose collections are very diverse (ceramics, glass, stone, metal, mosaics, tablets, coatings painted, jewelry, stabilized organic materials such as archaeological wood, etc.). The collections can range from small archaeological furniture through statuary or elements of ancient architecture to funerary art, whether modest or more monumental. The museum also organizes temporary exhibitions which often require moving collections, handling, installation of works (assembly and dismantling of temporary exhibitions), transport, handling load of very voluminous objects not only from the museum's collections but also belonging to other French and foreign institutions known as lenders. The services requested and described in the specifications are aimed at transport works and archaeological objects in France or abroad (with customs formalities), the logistical organization of loans between museums, conveying, packaging, manufacturing of crates, handling of fragile or heavy works, installation, necessary for temporary exhibitions or for all needs of the collections management service of the Lugdunum Museum Transport and handling of works of art and heritage collections for.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: EDF TRADING LOGISTICS. Summary: Services Provided by Terminal Safety Officer in the French West Indies. Description: EDF TL ensures logistical operations linked to the supply of fuels and/or liquid biomass for the electricity production plants of EDF PEI and EDF located in Martinique, Saint-Barthélemy, Saint-Martin and Guadeloupe. In order to guarantee the smooth running and safety of operations, EDF TL uses Terminal Safety Officer services for monitoring and assistance during unloading of ships carrying hydrocarbons and/or biomass liquid. Provision of TERMINAL SAFETY OFFICER services in the French West Indies. In order to guarantee the smooth running and safety of operations, EDF TL uses Terminal Safety Officer services for monitoring and assistance during unloading from ships carrying hydrocarbons and/or liquid biomass. The Terminal Safety Officer is an expert in petroleum and maritime operations. Its mission consists of supervising operations throughout the duration of unloading, ensuring the prevention of risks, the protection of people, installations and the environment, as well as compliance with established rules and good professional practices. The services take place in Martinique, Guadeloupe, Saint Barthélémy and Saint Martin. Doc Title: Services provided by TERMINAL SAFETY OFFICER in the French West Indies Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-01-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Services Provided by Terminal Safety Officer in the French West Indies

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PARIS AIRPORTS. Summary: Operation of the Valet and Valet Activity for Passengers at Paris-Charles De Gaulle Airport.. Description: The purpose of this consultation is the award of contracts allowing the exercise by the successful holder of the valet and valet activity, the handling, conveying, parking and return of passenger vehicles, by staff dedicated in specific public reception and operating areas of Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport. Operation of the valet and valet activity for passengers at Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport. Supporting Contracts the activity are granted for a period of 7 years, renewable three times per period of one year, will have an effective date of October 1, 2026 and the latest expiry date of October 1, 2036. The purpose of these Contracts is to describe the terms and conditions according to which the areas necessary for the activity are made available to the successful holder and operated by him at Paris - Charles de Gaulle airport. These contracts set out in particular the terms under which the successful holder pays Aéroports de Paris rents and is remunerated by marketing services to customers. In addition, these Contracts specify the conditions of membership of the future holder as (i) Seller on the Extime Marketplace, (ii) Partner of the Extime Rewards loyalty program and, (iii) Non-exclusive licensed user of the “Extime” brand. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PROVENCE-ALPES-CÔTE D-AZUR REGION. Summary: Public Service Delegation for the Management and Operation of Avignon Airport 2027-2036. Description: This consultation is organized within the framework of the provisions of the public procurement code as well as articles L.1411-1 et seq. and R.1411-1 of the General Code of Local Authorities. Candidates are therefore alerted to the fact that they must submit their application and their offer at the same time. The purpose of the public service delegation will be to entrust by leasing the operation, upkeep and maintenance of the airport, its land, structures, buildings, infrastructure, equipment, networks and services as well as the management and development of the airport public domain. Avignon-Provence airport, owned by the Provence Alpes Côte d'Azur Region since 2007, combines several assets for the benefit of the Vaucluse region and regional: an airport platform focused on business and leisure aviation which also operates essential civil security and emergency medical transport missions; a public airport domain welcoming more than 50 companies and 500 jobs. In order to consolidate these assets, the delegatee will have to develop and promote the airport following a strategy focused on business aviation and the continuation of the dynamic of economic development on the land of the platform by targeting activities with high added value and job creation. Its strategy will also include an ambitious environmental trajectory across the entire airport, strengthening its territorial roots while.... Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-02-01. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: METROPOLE NICE CÔTE D'AZUR. Summary: Public Service Concession Relating to the Rehabilitation and Operating of the Port of Beaulieu Ants. Description: The purpose of this consultation is the award by the Nice Côte d'Azur Metropolis of a public service concession contract. The purpose of the contract will be to entrust the concessionaire with the execution and financing of the port rehabilitation works. of Beaulieu Fourmis according to the program which will be given to candidates admitted to continue the procedure, operation, maintenance and management of the public port service of the port, at their own risk. PUBLIC SERVICE CONCESSION RELATING TO THE REHABILITATION AND OPERATING OF THE PORT OF BEAULIEU ANTS The concessionaire is responsible for operating and maintaining the port of Beaulieu Fourmis, at its own risk. He recruits and manages staff. The concessionaire must also design, carry out and finance port redevelopment work. The services expected from the future concessionaire will be specified in the “offer phase” consultation documents which will be sent only to candidates admitted to continue the procedure. The overall cost of the investment for the realization of the project was estimated at approximately 1.7 million euros (constant euros). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL OF HERAULT. Summary: Supply, Delivery of Tires, Accessories and Associated Services Intended for Vehicles and Machinery of the Hérault Departmental Council. Description: The framework agreement is concluded for an initial period of 12 months from the date of notification of the contract. The framework agreement will be executed by issuing purchase orders. Each lot will be awarded separately. The services are paid by unit prices and catalog prices. The estimated amounts are indicative and include all renewal periods. This contract concerns the supply and delivery of tires, accessories and services for the entire fleet of equipment and vehicles of the Hérault departmental council. Associated services are understood to mean operations delegated to the holder's premises (geometry of the front axle, exchange of a tire, etc.) and interventions in the sector of use of the vehicle (exchange, repair of a machine tire, agricultural tractor, heavy goods vehicle, etc.). Description: The City of Sarreguemines has decided to undertake an energy renovation operation for its existing public lighting fleet. In this context, the City is considering the conclusion of a Global Performance Market aimed at the installation of equipment high-quality public lighting, integrating a remote management device for each light point. This approach is based on the use of innovative technologies to ensure: - increased energy sobriety, - a notable reduction in the costs of operation (management, maintenance, operation), - and an overall improvement in the technical performance of the installations. The offers presented by the candidates must guarantee an optimal balance between energy sobriety, security and attractiveness. urban, while integrating the communication and consultation aspects necessary to inform the City and its citizens. This orientation is broken down into four priority areas: - Reduction of light pollution and preservation of biodiversity, - Optimization of electrical energy consumption, meeting a dual ecological and economic objective, - Deployment of advanced technologies (LED lighting, remote management systems), - Improvement of technical performances, including the renovation of assets, limiting the risks of breakdowns or disasters, and improving the living environment. The Contract Holder undertakes: - from the effective date of total receipt of .... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2025-12-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PAYS DE LA LOIRE REGION. Summary: Tariff Integration Surveys in Urban Perimeters. Description: In order to develop intermodality practices in collective passenger transport, the Pays de la Loire Region, in partnership with the urban mobility organizing authorities, has implemented fare integration agreements. These Fare systems currently allow access to regional trains within the territorial jurisdiction with urban tickets for journeys made entirely within this territorial jurisdiction. The purpose of this framework agreement is to carrying out measurements to know the proportion of travelers concerned, analyzing reliable and consolidated data, as well as calculating tariff compensation for each urban area. The incumbent will also be responsible for the presentation of all the results to the Region and its partners. TARIFF INTEGRATION SURVEYS IN URBAN PERIMETERS This framework agreement is mixed (article R2162-3 of the public procurement code); it can therefore be executed by means of purchase orders on the based on the prices indicated in the unit price schedule but also through subsequent contracts. This framework agreement is single-awarded. The minimum and maximum cumulative amounts of orders and subsequent contracts that can be carried out in the framework of this framework agreement are defined as follows: - minimum amount: €20,000 excluding VAT for 12 months - maximum amount: €250,000 excluding VAT for 12 months. Doc Title: TARIFF INTEGRATION SURVEYS IN URBAN PERIMETERS.... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: METROPOLE TOULON-PROVENCE-MEDITERRANEE. Summary: 25Four06 - Framework Agreement for Purchase Orders Relating to the Supply and Delivery of Street Furniture in the Eastern and Western Territories of the Toulon Provence Mediterranean Metropole. Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is the supply of street furniture (posts, street furniture for cycles, benches, baskets, bollards, barriers, hoops, urban cleanliness and for green spaces) for the entire Toulon Provence Méditerranée Metropolis, with the exception of the territories of Toulon and Revest. Lots 2 and 4 will be awarded according to a procedure separate from this consultation, in accordance with the provisions of article L. 2123-1 3° of the Public Procurement Code: Lot n°02: Supply of furniture for dog cleanliness (small batch procedure) excluded from the call for tenders Lot n°04: Supply of furniture from the CONCEPT URBAIN brand (small batch procedure) excluded from the call for tenders Candidates have the possibility to submit offers for the lots 1, 3, 5, and 7. Lot 6 will be the subject of a contract without advertising or competitive bidding estimated annually at 72,980 euros excluding tax, in accordance with articles L.2122-1 and R.2122-3-3° of the Public Procurement Code, due to the exclusivity of distribution of the supplies requested.. Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: 25Four06 - Framework Agreement for Purchase Orders Relating to the Supply and Delivery of Street Furniture in the Eastern and Western Territories of the Toulon Provence Mediterranean Metropole
output.Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is the supply of street furniture (posts, street furniture for cycles, benches, baskets, bollards, barriers, hoops, urban cleanliness and for green spaces) for the entire Toulon Provence Méditerranée Metropolis, with the exception of the territories of Toulon and Revest. Lots 2 and 4 will be awarded according to a procedure separate from this consultation, in accordance with the provisions of article L. 2123-1 3° of the Public Procurement Code: Lot n°02: Supply of furniture for dog cleanliness (small batch procedure) excluded from the call for tenders Lot n°04: Supply of furniture from the CONCEPT URBAIN brand (small batch procedure) excluded from the call for tenders Candidates have the possibility to submit offers for the lots 1, 3, 5, and 7. Lot 6 will be the subject of a contract without advertising or competitive bidding estimated annually at 72,980 euros excluding tax, in accordance with articles L.2122-1 and R.2122-3-3° of the Public Procurement Code, due to the exclusivity of distribution of the supplies requested.

Among these structures, two thirds of them have a hydraulic safety function and fall under the regulations relating to embankment systems; their maintenance is necessary. In this context, to be able to intervene the bank team needs different machines depending on the work to be carried out. Summary: Short Term Rental of Compaction and Vertical Loading Household Waste Dump with Crane and Kinshofer Type Hook Without Driver. It carries out all the missions related to waste collection under management: - Door to door collection; - Collection by voluntary contribution; - Operation of recycling centers. To do this, it has a fleet of vehicles which can be increased in summer to cope with seasonal activity. Recourse to rental can also be considered in the event of prolonged immobilization of vehicles and in order to avoid any disruption in public service. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SPL SPIIT- INTERREGIONAL PUBLIC COMPANY FOR INVESTMENTS IN FAVOR OF TRANSPORT. Summary: Level 4 and Level 5 Maintenance Services (Excluding Mid-Life Operations) and Maintenance Engineering for Railway Rolling Stock. Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is: (i) the performance of level 4 maintenance services (preventive and corrective) and (ii) the performance of level 4 and level 5 maintenance engineering services (excluding mid-life operations) on the railway rolling stock which will be entrusted to SPL SPIIT by the shareholder Regions. The equipment falling within the scope of the ownership of SPIIT will be made available to future Railway Operators as and when allocated by the Regions of public service operating contracts. To date, SPL SPIIT has as shareholders the Nouvelle-Aquitaine Region and the Occitanie Region, the entry of the Center Val de Loire Region into the capital of SPIIT is in progress as of the publication of the this framework agreement. SPIIT could, in the future, and during the execution of this framework agreement, be entrusted with the railway rolling stock of other Regions, if necessary, for the same objectives. "ECE D function maintenance of bogies, axles, reduction gears, electric traction motors Maintenance ECE D function of hitches, power and air production, braking system, suspension/damping valves Maintenance ECE D function of cabin and passenger air conditioning. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COTENTIN URBAN COMMUNITY. Summary: Execution of Non-Urban School Transport Services of the Cotentin Urban Community. Description: The services consist of the execution of all non-urban school races, located entirely within the territory of the Cotentin CA. The services organized by the Cotentin urban community are currently made up from: - 123 services primarily for schools, reserved primarily for students with a Cap Cotentin school or commercial subscription. - 14 secondary lines (S1 to S14). These secondary lines correspond to school circuits, which have the particularity of being open to the sale of single tickets - 16 shuttles to secondary schools from the exchange platforms (N1 to N20) The community will also be able to, if necessary and in ways one-off and experimental, set up secondary services for carrying out certain school outings as a continuation of existing services. Form of the contract: Framework agreements with purchase orders (art. R.2162-13 and R.2162-14 of Public Order Code) without minimum amount and with a maximum order amount per lot of 5,000,000 euro(s) excluding tax for lot 1 and 4,600,000 euro(s) excluding tax for lots 2 and 3 Sector A - West Creation of school circuits in the sector East Sector B - Center and South Creation of school circuits in the Center and South sector Sector C - East Doc Title: Execution of non-urban school transport services of the Urban Community.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COTENTIN AGGLOMERATION COMMUNITY. Summary: Execution of Non-Urban School Transport Services of the Cotentin Urban Community. Description: The services consist of the execution of all non-urban school races, located entirely within the territory of the Cotentin CA. The services organized by the Cotentin urban community are currently made up of: - 123 services primarily for schools, reserved primarily for students with a Cap Cotentin school or commercial subscription. - 14 secondary lines (S1 to S14). These secondary lines correspond to school circuits, which have the particularity of being open to the sale of single tickets - 16 shuttles to secondary establishments from the exchange platforms (N1 to N20) The community will also be able, if necessary, and in other ways one-off and experimental, set up secondary services for carrying out certain school outings as a continuation of existing services. Form of the contract: Framework agreements with purchase orders (art. R.2162-13 and R.2162-14 of Public Order Code) without minimum amount and with a maximum order amount per lot of 5,000,000 euro(s) excluding tax for lot 1 and 4,600,000 euro(s) excluding tax for lots 2 and 3. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SPL GRAND EST MOBILITY. Summary: Call for Expressions of Interest Relating to a Future Call for Competition for a Contract for the Management, Maintenance and Supply of Repairable Parts for Railway Rolling Stock (Prm) of the Regie.... Description: Call for Expressions of Interest relating to a future call for competition for a contract for the management, maintenance and supply of Repairable Parts for railway rolling stock (PRM) of the Regie...<br> The Grand Est Region is engaged in a process of competitive bidding for rail services, within the framework of the Railway Pact law of June 27, 2018. In this context, the SPL wishes to outsource the maintenance of Repairable Parts of railway rolling stock (PRM). This would involve carrying out the maintenance, supply and management of repairable parts of equipment in cooperation with railway operators for 125 regional AGCs, in particular. An initial stock of parts would be made available as part of the envisaged contract, the contract service provider could be required to supplement this stock as part of parts management. He would be responsible for maintenance on these parts, storage and delivery to the railway operators' sites.<br> This is in order to strengthen its mastery of the major challenge that constitutes PRMs in terms of maintenance and durability of its equipment.<br> The deadline for participation in the AMI is December 15, 2025 at 12 p.m.<br> The date of launch of the planned procedure is indicative<br> Call for Expressions of Interest relating to a future competition for a management contract, maintenance and supply of Repairable Parts for railway rolling stock (PRM) in the Grand Est Region<br> The Grand Est Region is engaged in a process of competitive bidding for services.... Summary: Service Concession for the Upkeep, Maintenance and Commercial Operation of Advertising Bus Shelters Owned by the Pays De Montbeliard. It is specified that only articles L. 1411-5, L. 1411-5-1, L. 1411-9 and L. 1411-18 of the CGCT apply to service concessions. The duration of the concession is set at 5 years. The contract runs from January 1, 2027 at 00:00 a.m. or on the day of its notification. The consultation includes a PSE (possible additional service) relating to the supply and installation of non-advertising bus shelters, advertising bus shelters and stop posts for the evolitY network. The response to this PES is not obligatory. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF PUTEAUX. Summary: Dematerialized Payment Solution for Parking. Description: The purpose of the contract is to set up a dematerialized payment solution for on-street parking. The objective is to expand the payment options offered to citizens for on-street parking by allowing them to pay for their parking remotely, via a platform accessible on the internet and mobile phone, with secure payment by credit card. In addition to the parking meters installed in the municipality, this market will aim to set up a completely dematerialized payment solution, allowing parking to be paid remotely. The platform proposed by the candidate must be accessible both via the internet and by mobile phone, thus offering optimal accessibility to users. Payment will be made by credit card and must guarantee a high level of security in order to protect users against any attempt to fraud. Amount and estimate: The contract is a multi-awardee framework agreement executed by purchase orders. The services of supply and access to the dematerialized payment solution, configuration of the platform, hosting, corrective maintenance of the solution, as well as the subscription to the solution are processed at fixed prices. The initial configuration of the solution, interfacing of the solution with a third-party system, and communication services are handled at unit prices. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF JOUY-EN-JOSAS. Summary: Regular School Transport for Children between the Parc De Diane District and the Bourget-Calmette School Group for the Period from 01/5/26 to 07/3/26. Description: This consultation concerns the provision of regular road transport services for children between the Parc de Diane district and the Bourget-Calmette school group, as part of a delegation of authority from IDFM. This service is part of a particular context which is that of the fire suffered by the Parc de Diane school group on November 23, 2025, rendering the building unusable for an indefinite period. The 100 children from the school group are welcomed into the group Bourget-Calmette school approximately 4 kilometers away. A collection circuit is thus provisionally set up, for a period going from Monday January 5, 2026 and extending, possibly, until Friday July 3, 2026 (unless reinstatement possible children in their school or other solution before this date), Mondays-Tuesdays-Thursdays-Fridays outside school holidays and public holidays, for entry (8:30 a.m.) and leaving classes (4:30 p.m.). One possibility, included in the contract, will be to add a circuit at 6 p.m. or 6:30 p.m., depending on how the situation evolves.. Published Date: 2025-11-29. Closing Date: 2025-12-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Regular School Transport for Children between the Parc De Diane District and the Bourget-Calmette School Group for the Period from 01/5/26 to 07/3/26

This service is part of a particular context which is that of the fire suffered by the Parc de Diane school group on November 23, 2025, rendering the building unusable for an indefinite period. The 100 children from the school group are welcomed into the group Bourget-Calmette school approximately 4 kilometers away. A collection circuit is thus provisionally set up, for a period going from Monday January 5, 2026 and extending, possibly, until Friday July 3, 2026 (unless reinstatement possible children in their school or other solution before this date), Mondays-Tuesdays-Thursdays-Fridays outside school holidays and public holidays, for entry (8:30 a.m.) and leaving classes (4:30 p.m.). One possibility, included in the contract, will be to add a circuit at 6 p.m. or 6:30 p.m., depending on how the situation evolves.

His ambition : strengthen the attractiveness of the port, streamline the transport chain and accelerate decarbonization.<br> This concession concerns the promotion, operation and management:<br> - the multimodal terminal and the intra-port rail transfer system between the multimodal terminal and the terminals maritime. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SIGERLY PURCHASING CENTRAL. Summary: Supply and Design of Decoration Patterns and Festive 4-Season Lighting. Description: Mixed framework agreement with purchase orders and subsequent contracts, for services relating to four-season festive decorations and lighting.<br> As an indication and not limitation, the Framework Agreement includes the following services;<br> - Purchase/rental of new or reconditioned decoration patterns on catalog<br> - Purchase of custom-made decoration patterns<br> - Maintenance of rental patterns<br> - Advice and support for the choice and implementation of patterns.<br> Supply and design of 4-season decoration and lighting designs<br> This framework purchase order agreement and subsequent contracts aims to supply (purchase/rent) and design decoration and lighting designs for beneficiary members over all periods of the year.<br> A list of designs is set out in the unit price schedule, these are ordered at according to the needs of the beneficiaries. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CORRÈZE DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL. Summary: School Transport for Students with Disabilities (2025aff051). Description: The main characteristics are as follows: - ensure, in accordance with the legislative and regulatory provisions in force, the transport of students with disabilities and specialized classes schooled in the Department of Corrèze (transport to and from students from their homes to educational establishments), - implement the services concerned during the school periods considered, once the routes, timetables and timetable assignments have been approved according to the terms which will be set out in the technical annex to the order forms. The Department takes charge of setting up specific transport for pupils and students with disabilities residing in Corrèze attending a public or private general, agricultural or professional education establishment when they cannot use public transport due to the severity of their medically recognized disability transmitted by the Departmental Center for Disabled Persons.. Description: As part of its environmental preservation policy, the City of Bouillante has planned the installation of anchorages and screw anchors spread over two sites - Bourg and Malendure - in order to accommodate both pleasure craft and professional vessels. To ensure management optimal use of this equipment, the City of Bouillante wishes to equip itself with a dedicated boat. This should allow municipal agents to move easily to ships, to dock in complete safety, to control and maintain mooring devices, but also to carry out missions monitoring, intervention and user awareness.. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MEURTHE ET MOSELLE DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL. Summary: Supply and Installation of Vertical Signage for Roads in the Department of Meurthe-Et-Moselle. Description: This is a framework agreement with purchase orders concluded from 01/01/2026 until 12/31/2025, subject to notification of the contract on this date, and tacitly renewable 3 times for periods of one year, within the limit of 4 years in total. Failing this, it will be concluded from its notification until 12/31/26. This framework agreement is made up of 2 lots, each subject to a separate allocation. The services are regulated by unit prices within the following limits: - Lot 01 - Supply and/or installation of police and directional signage: 100,000 euros excluding VAT minimum for one year, i.e. 400,000 euros excluding tax minimum for the entire contract and 1,000,000 euros excluding tax maximum for one year, or 4,000,000 euros excluding tax for 4 years. - Lot 02 - Supply of temporary vertical signage: 20,000 euros excluding VAT minimum for one year, i.e. 80,000 euros excluding VAT minimum for the entire contract and 600 000 euros excluding tax for one year, or 2,400,000 euros excluding tax for 4 years. For lot 01, in accordance with article L 2112-2 of the public procurement code, this contract includes a mandatory clause d'insertion. Published Date: 2025-11-17. Closing Date: 2025-12-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Supply and Installation of Vertical Signage for Roads in the Department of Meurthe-Et-Moselle

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SEMITAN, NANTES METROPOLE OFFICER. Summary: Design and Manufacturing of a Fleet of Enavibus. Description: As part of a project management mandate, Nantes Metropole entrusted Semitan with the design and manufacture of a fleet of 5 electric propulsion boats called eNavibus dedicated to the Navibus Loire service, as well as the adaptation of associated infrastructure such as the supply and installation of electrical charging stations dedicated to boats. The purpose of this consultation is to designate the holder of the industrial market for the manufacture of passenger transport vessels. The services to be carried out by the holder concern the following areas: - Naval architecture - Shipbuilding - Energy management and hybridization - Sizing of an energy system - Maritime electrical load - Naval maintenance during the period of guarantee. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: INTERCOMMUNAL COMMUNITY NORTH REUNION. Summary: Supply and Maintenance of Cinor Garbage Bins. Description: The contract consists of: FIRM SECTION: - The supply of new garbage bins intended for the collection of residual household waste, recyclable waste, and bio-waste (lots 1 and 2). - The supply of new garbage bins intended for the collection of residual household waste, recyclable waste, and bio-waste (lots 1 and 2). - Maintenance of the trash bin fleet, belonging to CINOR (lots 1 and 2). - The temporary provision of garbage bins (lots 1 and 2). - The recovery and recycling of used bins (lots 1 and 2). - Computerized management of the fleet containers (lots 1 and 2). - Management and recording of calls, and organization of deliveries (lots 1 and 2). OPTIONAL TRANCHES (TO): - TO NO1 (lots 1 and 2): Chipping campaigns. - TO NO2 (lots 1 and 2): Analyzes and staffing surveys with a view to preventive or upgrading maintenance updating/adjustments of allocations on all or part of the park. - TO NO3 (lot 2): Supply, installation and maintenance of bio-waste bin shelters. The estimated value and the maximum value of the framework agreement mentioned in section 2.1.3 of this notice are those of the cumulative amount of lots 1 and 2 over the total duration of the market (4 years).. Published Date: 2025-11-17. Closing Date: 2025-12-31. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF CORSICA. Summary: Operation of School Transport Services in Haute-Corse - Relaunch Lot 18. Description: This consultation follows procedures declared without further action and bearing the references: - 2025-3DTM-0002 (initial procedure 73 lots) - 2025-3DTM-0181 (procedure 18 lots). This consultation only concerns lot 18. Consequently, given the obligation to ensure continuity of the public school transport service, in accordance with article R2161-3 of the public procurement code, the normal deadlines for receiving applications and offers are made impracticable. The contracting authority therefore reduces the deadline for submitting offers to 15 days. The award procedure of this framework agreement, which will be entrusted to school transport companies, is broken down into 161 lines spread over 73 lots. The service consists of implementing the school transport circuits concerned following the routes and times defined in the specifications. THE The estimated number of days of operation for the 2025-2026 school year, given as an indication, could be established as follows: - For middle and high schools: 175 days/year - For primary schools: 140 days/year - 1 outward journey (morning/1 return evening) per day according to the school calendar services are allocated, each lot being a framework agreement with purchase orders accompanied by a minimum and a maximum expressed in quantity specified below: - Lots 26, 30, 35, 40, 47, 56, 57 Minimum 540 days - Maximum 680 days - Other lots Minimum 660 days - Maximum 820 days. Published Date: 2025-11-14. Closing Date: 2025-11-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Description: Call for Expressions of Interest relating to a future call for competition for a contract for the management, maintenance and supply of Repairable Parts for railway rolling stock (PRM) of the Regime...<br> The Grand Est Region is engaged in a process of competitive bidding for rail services, within the framework of the Railway Pact law of June 27, 2018. In this context, the SPL wishes to outsource the maintenance of Repairable Parts of railway rolling stock (PRM). This would involve carrying out the maintenance, supply and management of repairable parts of equipment in cooperation with railway operators for 125 regional AGCs, in particular. An initial stock of parts would be made available as part of the envisaged contract, the contract service provider could be required to supplement this stock as part of parts management. He would be responsible for maintenance on these parts, storage and delivery to the railway operators' sites.<br> This is in order to strengthen its mastery of the major challenge that constitutes PRMs in terms of maintenance and durability of its equipment.<br> The deadline for participation in the AMI is December 15, 2025 at 12 p.m.<br> The date of launch of the planned procedure is indicative<br> Call for Expressions of Interest relating to a future competition for a management contract, maintenance and supply of Repairable Parts for railway rolling stock (PRM) in the Grand Est Region<br> The Grand Est Region is engaged in a process of competitive bidding for services...

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PAVILLONSSOUSBOIS TOWN HALL. Summary: Supply of Street Furniture and Vertical Signage Equipment for the Town of Pavillons-Sous-Bois. Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is to supply street furniture and vertical signage equipment for the town of Pavillons-sous-Bois. It is divided into 3 lots. The single-awardee framework agreement is established in accordance with the provisions of articles R. 2162-1 to R. 2162-6 and R. 2162-13 to R. 2162-14 of the Public Procurement Code. The framework agreement is concluded without a minimum annual amount and with a maximum annual amount such as this amount appears in the description specific to each lot. The detail of the services payable by the holder and their technical specifications are specified in the Specifications of Special Technical Clauses (CCTP) and the Unit Price Schedule (BPU) specific to each lot. Supply of posts and barriers Lot n°1 concerns the supply of posts and barriers for the City of Pavillons-sous-Bois. As an indication, each year the City purchases a quantity of approximately 200 ball posts, 100 PRM posts, 200 barriers of width 1.50M and 100 barriers of width 1.00M. The services will be settled by the application of the unit prices as they appear: in the Unit Price Schedule (BPU), specific to each lot and attached to this framework agreement; in the updated catalog/general price list of the holder annually and to which the discount rate indicated in the BPU is applied for supplies falling within the scope of the framework agreement but not appearing in the BPU. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF SANARY SUR MER (83). Summary: Intra and Extra Muror Transport Services by Means of Coaches with Driver for the Needs of the Municipality of Sanary-Sur-Mer. Description: The purpose of this contract is to provide intra and extra muros transport services by means of coaches with drivers for the needs of the municipality of Sanary-sur-Mer. INTRA AND EXTRA MUROS TRANSPORT SERVICES BY MEANS OF COACHES WITH DRIVERS FOR THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY OF SANARY-SUR-MER The provision of intra and extra muros transport services by means of coaches with drivers for the needs of the municipality of Sanary sur mer are of two types: •Intramural as part of travel to the town of Sanary-sur-Mer. •Extramural as part of travel outside the City of Sanary-sur-Mer. The services covered by this contract are carried out mainly within the framework of school and extracurricular activities. They concern the transport of students from public nursery and elementary schools in the Municipality, from their establishments to municipal facilities or to external destinations, as part of educational and educational projects. They may also relate to the transport of adolescents and/or adults, in particular during shuttles organized during municipal events or events, as well as, more exceptionally, to other occasional needs of the Municipality. So the services include the following types of journeys: •Short shuttle-type journeys •Short intramural journeys •Short journeys extra muros are between 10 and 50 km round trip (neighboring towns) •.... Published Date: 2025-11-11. Closing Date: 2025-12-10. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CMAR PACA. Summary: Travel Agency Services of Cma Provence Alpes Cote D'azur (Transport, Accommodation, other Services and Booking Tool). Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is to provide travel agency services (online and offline) for the travel of agents of the Chamber of Trades and Crafts of the Provence Alpes Cote d'Azur Region (CMAR PACA), as well as the configuration of the reservation and management tool/portal. "Online". This framework agreement is concluded according to the formalized procedure. This is an open call for tenders, in accordance with the provisions of articles L 2124-1 and 2124-2 and R 2124-1 and R2124-2 and R2161-2 to R2161-5 of the public procurement code. The services give rise to a framework agreement single awardee which is executed by purchase orders, with no minimum and a maximum financial value of 200,000 euros including tax for the initial duration of the framework agreement. In the event of renewal, the maximum amount will also be 200,000 euros including tax per renewal period. Services are performed as purchase orders are issued, in application of articles R2162-1 to R2162-6 and R2162-13 to R2162-14 of the Public Procurement Code. This framework agreement is entered into for a period of one year from its notification. It therefore takes effect from this date. It is renewable three times for a period of one (1) year. The estimated start date for performance of the services is scheduled for February 2026. The expected services are described in the Specifications of Special Technical Clauses (CCTP).. Published Date: 2025-11-10. Closing Date: 2025-12-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ILE DE FRANCE MOBILITIES. Summary: Prior Information Notice Relating to the Public Service Concession for the Operation of Bus Lines Serving the Agglomeration Community of Val D'yerres Val De Seine (Dsp20). Description: Ile-de-France Mobilites, the organizing authority for mobility throughout the Ile-de-France Region, designates the transport operators of the public transport networks in Ile-de-France. As such, this opinion concerns the competition between regular road transport networks of travelers serving the Val d'Yerres Val de Seine conurbation. The public service contract awarded by Ile-de-France Mobilites will entrust the operation of the passenger transport service (bus) and will include approximately 28 administrative lines, 36 regular commercial lines and 10 public transport buses. evening, representing approximately 6,340,000 KCC in 2025. The contract holder will be entrusted with the operation of the transport service for the lines identified above, as well as part of the maintenance, and where applicable part of the renewal, of the service assets which will be made available its disposition. The scope of the contract will be specified in the DCE. At this stage, it is envisaged to entrust the following main services: operating the road transport service by bus and the maintenance and storage centers in the geographical area concerned, ensuring marketing and the distribution of transport tickets, ensure the safekeeping, upkeep and maintenance of passenger rolling stock, ensure the upkeep and upkeep of finishing work, equipment, furniture, fittings and systems in maintenance and storage centers, .... Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-12-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
